intro: Tetraphyle littoralis, commonly known as the coastal four-leaf plant, is a rare flowering species native to rocky shorelines. It thrives in saline and humid environments, showcasing adaptations to withstand tidal fluctuations and salt spray. The plant features four distinct leaf lobes, giving it its common name, and produces small, fragrant white flowers. Its root system is dense and fibrous, anchoring it firmly in coastal soils. Botanically, it belongs to the family Polygonaceae, characterized by its unique leaf morphology and ecological resilience.
